thread.title: Woman hit by car on footpath
thread.title_full: Woman hit by car on footpath

title: Woman hit by car on footpath
text:
Woman hit by car in Chatswood North Shore Times February 24, 2017 11:11am 
A WOMAN is in hospital fighting for her life after being hit by a car in Chatswood this morning. 
Police said that just before 8.30am, a 67-year-old man was driving a Toyota sedan on Victoria Ave when it left the road and hit a woman who was walking along the footpath. 
The car then crashed into a nearby pole and flipped onto its side. 
Emergency services were called to the scene, where the woman was found with serious head injuries. 
Police have been told that a child in a pram, who was also caught up in the incident, was not injured and had been taken by family to a medical centre to be checked as a precaution. 
Victoria Ave is closed in both directions between Neridah and Archer streets. The aftermath of an incident on Victoria Ave, Chatswood today. Picture: Steve Hui (@iFLYflat) Twitter. media_camera The trail of destruction after a car mounted the footpath in Chatswood this morning. Picture: Virgina Young 
CareFlight were called at 8.34am, with the helicopter landing in Beauchamp Park, Chatswood, with a specialist doctor and paramedic on board. 
The injured woman, believed to be aged in her 30s, was taken by road, with the doctor and paramedic, to Royal North Shore Hospital in a critical condition. 
The helicopter will remain at the park until the doctors return and can be returned to base. 
The male driver, 67, was treated at the scene for minor injuries and will undergo mandatory blood and urine testing. #CHATSWOOD : Victoria Ave is closed between Neridah St & Archer St due to a car crash, motorists advised to avoid the area. @7NewsSydney pic.twitter.com/maErkZhSdJ â€” Han Nguyen (@HanNguyenNews) February 23, 2017 media_camera Police taped off the scene of an accident on the corner of Victoria Ave and Archer St on Friday morning at 8.30am. media_camera Onlookers photograph the scene of a crash in Chatswood. Picture: Virgina Young 
Police from North Shore Local Area Command, with the assistance of the Metropolitan Crash Investigation Unit, continue to investigate the accident. 
Motorists are advised to delay travel or avoid the area where possible. media_camera
